definition: to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: I think that it is arbitrary.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這個是主觀專斷。

sentences.english: But that's arbitrary from a moral point of view.
sentences.chinese: 那是一種道德看法的專斷。

sentences.english: To prevent the tendency to make decision arbitrarily and go their own way and oppose the defiance of orders and prohibitions.
sentences.chinese: 防止個人專斷和各自爲政，反對有令不行，有禁不止。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
